content.html:
Formatting is a critical step for Exorde, where information is cut into “facts”. These “facts” must be chosen carefully to respond to two criteria: relevance (prioritizing viral information), and verifiability (facts that are relayed by multiple information sources are a priority).

These formatted sections help Exorde target its mapping of the Internet around key information points.

As a Formatter, you can vote on formats proposed by others. As for all other operations on Exorde, a small stake in EXD will be deducted from your virtual wallet to avoid spamming and enforce quality.

Once a certain amount of votes has been reached on a proposed format, it becomes locked for validation.

If you believe a format is missing or incomplete, you can propose a new one!

If you believe all the important facts in the information source are locked for validation, you can vote to close the session. Votes for closing the session are reset every time a new format is locked.

Once the session is closed format-checkers will check all the proposed formats. If they are all accepted, all formatters having voted on formats that were accepted will be rewarded. Formatters having voted on ending the session will be rewarded as well.
